start.speaker: Rusk
start.text:
Steel remembers the hand that shaped it.

If you want me along, you respect the craft—and you don’t ask me to make monsters easier.

choices.text: Come with me. We’ll make tools, not horrors.
I can’t promise what I’ll need forged.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Rusk’s laugh is like a hammer on anvil—loud, honest, and not afraid of sparks.
